profile.title: Reviews are Right - It Doesn't Brush :/
profile.text:
I saw the reviews that said it doesn't do anything, but I was hoping it was more subjective and maybe it might work for me. Nope, it really doesn't brush anything.

- Bristles are weak, arrived bent
-Maaaaybe could work if you have super thin hair
- Thin and flimsy feeling if that's a concern

I use "wet" hairbrushes that are designed like this, and I have to say that the quality really varies. I have a couple that I love and work wonderfully--brushes tangled wet hair painlessly, evenly brushes hair to tie it up. I've only tried 4 brands, but this is the worst I've seen. The bristles are weak--they're really thin, even for wet brushes, and they arrived bent (not because it was used--it was in the plastic wrap and everything). I do have thick hair, but this is the first brush I've used (of ANY kind--tiny travel ones included) that feels like it's literally going on top of my hair and not through it at all, even when I try to press down. It maaay work if you have thin hair, but I mean really thin hair, and even them I'm doubtful.

I bought this hoping I could use it as a travel brush, so I wasn't too picky as long as it brushed relatively okay. Obviously not, but the plastic is also lighter and thinner than I expected it to be, again, even for a small travel brush, so I'm doubtful it or the hinge wouldn't break easily with pressure while trying to brush thick or tangly hair.

profile.title: Allergic reaction
profile.text:
After putting in my hair. I developed a huge gland behind my ear. Not realizing it was the hair i kept it in for another week. It got to a point where I couldn't even move my neck. then I noticed My scalp started to flake and bleed and I lost my hair in the middle of my scalp. Took the hair out immediately and literally within 8 hours the enlarged gland started to subside.
I don't know what type of chemical was in the hair but my body did not like it. Don't get me wrong I loved the hair and color. But what it did to me I wouldn't wish on anyone. It may not cause issues on everyone but im just sharing my experience.

profile.title: An absolute nightmare
profile.text:
I wrote a good review at first, but after reading what others had said and having my own awful experience, I realize this product is trash. It was amazing for the first month and a half. I really needed an easier way to floss with braces. I've struggled with the health of my teeth all of my life, and this product seemed like a godsend.

It only took a little over a month for the device to no longer charge. I'd leave it plugged in, but the light would still be flashing to indicate it was charging after several hours. I'd remove it from the charger, thinking it had enough of a charge to do its job, only for it to flash red to indicate the battery was low.

Awfully convenient that this product stops working just a little while after it's too late to get a refund. This is devastating for me, personally. I don't have enough money to purchase one of these that would actually be worth investing in, so now I'll be spending an extra half an hour in my bathroom struggling to get floss around my braces until I can afford a replacement.

This is so discouraging for an adult who has been trying to repair her smile for a huge part of her life. Do not bother with it.

profile.title: Effective, Cordless and Plenty of Water Storage

When I saw a cordless version that would do the same, I jumped at the chance. It is affordable, always a plus, and works with equal water pressure, which is essential as I have tightly spaced teeth. It took me a day or so to get used to the size as it is a little larger than I'd imagined, but the 300 ml water storage is precisely what is needed to do a thorough job. I charged it one time and have been using it daily for two weeks now. I love it.

profile.title: Perfect for blemish prone, oily skins
profile.text: Very happy w/this purchase, what a great price for 2 high quality masks! Feels very nice, smooth and cool going on, dries hard like a regular clay mask. Love the packaging- I'm a sucker for a nice glass jar; it also makes it easy to use every last bit. As someone who loathes waste, I appreciated also the jar is filled to the top with product. I like the ingredients list, lots of good stuff for oily, congestion prone skin. I've come to appreciate having oily skin as it's kept fine lines at bay, but it's still a pain to deal with, just not as much as dryness. My skin felt so clean after using this, and actually had more of a matte finish- usually I'm still gleaming shiny after washing my face. It doesn't say how long to leave it on, and says you can use as an overnight spot treatment which I will try during my next breakout. As a mask, I left it on about 10 min. It did have a very light tingle to me. If you have oily skin, you will love this mask!

profile.title: YES! High end product at an affordable price, excellent for acne or breakouts!
profile.text:
We used to use this at the high-end spa I work at, until they decided to change product lines a few years ago.
I absolutely LOVE this stuff!
If I feel a breakout coming on this kills it before it can even reach the surface. It does have a strong tea tree smell to it so if you don’t like that it may not be for you but personally I love the smell and tingle it gives. Be sure to moisturize well after rinsing, as it can be drying (YES even if you have acne - balancing moisture is a vital part of the process!) You can also use it as a spot treatment overnight and it will shrink your pimple and reduce the redness. DO NOT POP YOUR PIMPLES! I can’t explain this enough to people, but it will damage the skin and leave scarring, especially when it’s not ready and/or done with your bare hands - that allows bacteria into the pore and will further irritate the healing process. There are many different types of acne, and some you just should never pop. If you can’t afford to get to a dermatologist, you can always visit a local cosmetology school. They may be able to give you some ideas on what products to use, and can safely extract a pimple if needed. It’s affordable & will save you a LOT of money on micro needling or laser treatments down the road. I’m just telling you from experience ;)

profile.text: I am dealing with some hair loss issues due to medical issues and have been really self-conscious about it.  I watched a video of a woman with similar issues that had purchased something similar and wore it with wide scarves and headbands to conceal her hair loss.  I thought I'd give this idea a try. After looking and many of these and reading tons of reviews, I settled on this brand.  I am so glad that I did! The color matches my hair perfectly (medium brown) and it is so darn cute.  I wanted bigger hair so I bought two and I double them up. I have gotten compliments on my hair and have gained confidence when I go out wearing these.  I am so obsessed with these hair pieces!

profile.title: A Brick in a Can
profile.text: I've tried many beard products (including many beard balms), but this is absolutely nothing like anything I have tried before.  Granted, it is labeled as a wax, so I expected it to be a little stiffer and to provide more hold.  But it's so hard in the can, I had to use a hair dryer to get it to soften up enough to be able to apply it.  Melting it by rubbing your hands together...good luck with that.  I tried it a couple of times and easily concluded this is definitely NOT what I was looking for.  The scent is fine and not too strong.  I'm moving on to another product...one that I don't have to heat up with a hair dryer for several minutes before I can apply it.

profile.title: Not worth it, TikTok hype and it’s completely worthless
profile.text:
The hype all over TikTok for this product is completely absurd. As an aesthetician I decided to “test” the product and confirm if in fact this was a “miracle product”.

Results:
-it’s a mediocre clay mask
- dries within the 5-10 minutes as described depending on how thick you layer it on
- easily washes off with water
- my face looked exactly the same before and after with no significant changes

Overall, I think this is just another hyped up product which doesn’t deliver anything extraordinary. Clay masks typically reduce oil and tighten enlarged pores but this one does neither significantly. I’ve used better clay masks than this one. Done waste your money, or if you’re like me and just “want to try it” go for it...maybe you’ll have a different opinion.

profile.title: So many to choose from!!!!
profile.text:
Good morning, class!!! I do my own nails to save money, usually with adhesive nail strips. But, I needed something to up my nail game!! Are you seeking quality rhinestones? Well stop looking, because here they are!!! #TakeNotes
Likes...
1. This set has six colors and they all have many different shapes and sizes to choose from!
2. The flatback makes them easy to glue and hold in place.
3. You can choose from small round shapes to larger star, heart or diamond shapes. AND...
4. To make it easy to grab and place your rhinestones, a flat L-shaped tweezer with a pointy end is included.
Room for improvement:
You need to buy glue, it's not included. #DontForget
The cute shapes are not the same for each color...I got only one black star, one green heart, and one beautiful iridescent oblong diamond. Also, the cute shapes are all larger sizes and take up lots of space on my short nails.
Lastly, the white pencil is not waxy, and didn't pick up the rhinestones, but I didn't need it.
OKAY, STOP SCROLLING... THIS IS IT! You cannot go wrong with this set. It should be in your collection, I am happy it's in mine. Raise your hand if you #PutEmInTheCart !!!!
#LetsHeadToCheckout #ClassIsDismissed

profile.title: Save your money - Khaki Forest
profile.text: So, basically I am giving this product a pretty low score, as it DOES NOTHING GOOD. I have medium dark hair, so I did a lot of research before this dye. And this product has an expressed warranty about its effect, based on the different shades of the original hair color. It did mention that the medium dark hair would have some green taints. However, it didn’t work. My hair turned red. I may accept it showing nothing, but I  cannot accept it turning my hair into RED when I purchased a GREEN hair color dye! I strongly doubt whether it’s really KAO as my Japanese friend had a different experience while she has similar hair color as mine. Save your money and don’t buy it or buy one from official access.

profile.title: Beautiful Color and Easy to use!!!
profile.text:
I LOVE this hair dye!! It's so easy to use and super gentle on my hair :)

Why I love this product:
-Super easy to use! (When you fellow the directions)
-Lots of product. I have have long hair and I had more than enough to cover all my hair.
-Not damaging to my hair. (leaves it soft and not dried out)
-Nice tinge of color that give my hair depth and shine.

Why I wanted to leave this review:
-This product is not a permanent color. IT WILL NOT COVER GRAYS!!!
(stop UNINTELLIGENT reviews stating that it doesn't cover gray hair, BECAUSE IT's Not design to do so!!!)
-It states on the box that it's for BLACK hair!

Thank you for reading my review, I hope you enjoyed the product as much as I did.

...the packaging looks like its designed for the 99 cent store or Dollar Tree. There is no visible label that says these flowers are certified organic, just a worn out sticker with a generic description. The flowers themselves look old. I wouldn't be surprised if these were bought in bulk years ago and packaged to be resold on Amazon.

My purpose for using these (as they said certified organic in the description) was for food, smoking and tea. But as is I'll probably end up just using them for incense now.

:-/

Oh well.

profile.title: Big hair stays dry
profile.text: I absolutely ordered this shower cap because it looked cute in the picture. I am so happy to say that it is just as cute in person! The elastic is around about 2/3 of the bottom and that bow? a) Adorable but b) TOTALLY FUNCTIONAL! You can retie the bow in the front to make the cap tighter or looser based on your own preference (or head size). The back of my hair did get a little wet but this is a shower cap, not press-n-seal. Because the cap itself is a bit poofy, my top-of-my-head ponytail can stay in and I have no worries that my shower cap will be too small.  Love this!

profile.title: DURABLE AND CUTE
profile.text:
Very sassy cute....just for myself and no one else since it is a shower cap. I use it even to keep my hair away from me when I am applying makeup.

It's comfortable. It serves its purpose. It keeps my hair up and away from getting wet. Hair stays dry. I have thin hair but a lot of it and it's long and not one strand gets wet if I don't want it to. It doesn't slide off...the elastic keeps it in place. It's made from a material that seems to last. Durable. Over one full month using this off and on and I have no issues. It's still complete and has no rips or tears. It feels like a thick bag....or like a lighter version of a pool liner. Sturdy. Cleaning it is easy. I actually don't put mine in the washer and dryer. I just hand wash at the sink if I need to which I don't really. It's all you really need because of the material it's made from.

Bonus is that it comes with 2 and I have yet to use the other one.

profile.title: LUSH BUT ALSO NATURAL...NOT EYEGLASSES FRIENDLY
profile.text:
I know it doesn't seem like lush and sparse would be used to effectively describe the exact same thing but for me it's how I can explain these lashes. They are lush where they need to be, how they need to be, but sparse enough to give a more natural look. It's really a perfect combination of a wispy eyelash!!

Very pretty, natural with a flair. So fun to wear. Easy on the eyes. Not painful to wear. The fit is good but can be adjusted with some cutting. Doesn't comprise the integrity of the lash band. I can wear one pair several times before needing to dispose them. It's a lot of lashes and the possibility of many lash looks. After a month I still have so much to continue to work with before I need to reorder. They stay on great.

Only issue...they are long so it's not the most comfortable to wear with glasses. I reserve these lashes for nighttime wear or when I don't need to wear glasses in the day.

profile.title: Good for thick hair!
profile.text:
I have long, thick hair and was looking for a cap that would completely cover my head with a big bun on top. This was perfect. I've already thrown out all my old flimsy caps.

This cap is durable and thick with a nice flat band that has elastic in the back. It fits well and I feel very secure that my hair won't get wet underneath. It's cute to with the bow in the front.

profile.title: Good for beginners
profile.text:
I like cream contour sticks. I normally use the Fenty Skinstick but I'm always looking for a more affordable option.

This stick was nice. It applies easily, is creamy and has a decent pigment. I had no problem blending it. Overall I think it's a good product.

For me personally, I don't think the highlight shade was the most flattering on my medium olive skin tone. It was a little too light and had glitter. The glitter was ok, but I'd like a highlight to use all over the face without glitter.

I probably won't be replacing my Fenty stick for this but it's worth giving it a try. Especially if you are a beginner and just want to try it out.

I would not recommend.

profile.title: Not sure I'm doing it right
profile.text:
Starting off this is my first experience with magnetic lashes and false lashes in general. Never liked the idea of glue but wanted to try these.
No clue if I'm doing it right, I followed these instructions, multiple YouTube tutorials, tons of trial and error.
I like that there's a variety of different styles but I can't tell which are supposed to be on what eye. They are idental on both ends on both lashes in each pair.
The tweezers honestly seem useless to me as they're metal so the lashes stick to them which complicates all this lol.
The eyeliners provided aren't ideal (I do felt tip) but usable. I tried thin line, thick line. Didn't seem to matter when putting them on. There's no way to adjust them once they're placed though, the liner comes off with the lashes which kinda sucks for a newbie like me. It also makes them hard to clean and reapply so I've moved onto different ones if I have to take it off.
Not sure if I'm doing it wrong. They don't seem to adhere as well to the outer corners. Also possibly they're too long for me but not exactly sure these kind can be trimmed as they only have 5 long magnets (2 being at the ends)
One magnet came off one pair and stayed stuck on the packaging base they come on. Kinda bummed because those were the least extreme ones. (Wanted to get used to the simple ones before going bigger/fluffier/longer).

Overall the cost was not bad for experimenting. Am gonna look at ones in stores closer to see if any maybe have more/smaller magnets.

profile.title: Love these for putting on facemasks!
profile.text:
I love using these to put on face masks. I feel like I get it to go on smoother and can spread masks much more evenly. I also like that it saves me from getting the masks stuck around my nailbeds.

I like that this came in a 6 pack - seems like a great thing to bring to a bachelorette party/girls weekend where we'll all be doing masks together.

profile.title: A gentle shave
profile.text:
This is my first time trying out an electric razor.
I used it to shave my arm pits and my legs. I think overall it did an okay job but I didn't get quite as close of a shave as I do when I use a regular razor and shaving cream. Part of this may have been due to user error/just not being used to this method.

Overall, it was comfortable to use. It is nice and lightweight. It didn't cause any razor burn.

I think I still feel more comfortable using a traditional razor on my legs as far as getting a close shave, but I plan to continue to use this for my armpits and bikini area because I read online that this type of razor is less likely to contribute to ingrown hairs and overall be gentler on the skin.

profile.title: Works well on tan skin
profile.text:
I like this contour stick a lot.
I use tarte foundation in medium tan honey and used this on top of that. It's not the darkest contour product I've used, and I might even want a slightly deeper shade for the dark side, but overall I do like this. It blended in easily,
I got the lotus and light brown. I am Asian and have kind of tan skin right now.

After some time, I've updated this review and taken off one star because it is harder to blend in than powder contouring products, and I feel like it doesn't stay in place all day as well.

Overall would recommend this.

profile.title: A little bigger than it needs to be.  3.5/5 stars
profile.text:
This brush was pretty nice overall as a foundation brush. But it is slightly bigger than it needs to be, in my opinion. Which meant it was hard to not get it into my hairline a bit.

I also found that the hair of the brush wasn't necessarily packed as tight together as other brands I've used. This means more of the liquid foundation seeps into the brush/is kind of wasted. But overall, it still worked really well. I think brushes are a much better alternative to fingers and I like the smooth, blended look it created.

As other reviewers have mentioned, the handle wasn't the stiffest... so I ended up holding it pretty high up on the handle, but that wasn't really a problem.

profile.title: save on the clean-up
profile.text: These are sturdy and shouldn't fail; made of a durable material. Just use and throw away when finished - no more clean-up!

profile.title: It’s a NEED
profile.text: I wasn’t using my air fryer as much as I wanted to because it was a pain to clean the basket with all the little holes. These liners are a life saver and have gotten me to start using my air fryer way more. They don’t burn up or anything - they’re parchment paper. And they’re extremely sturdy. I made bbq chicken and none of the bbq sauce soaked through one liner whatsoever. I do wish they were a smidge bigger, but that’s because I have the XL air fryer. It fits 2 regular sized chicken breasts. I love how easy it is to use these and then just throw them away, and the pack comes with plenty to keep you stocked up. Sooo happy and impressed with these.

profile.text: I own a bunch of pet brushes similar to this style with the self-cleaning feature. I'm super impressed with this one. It glides through fur as it should and doesn't snag/tug. It quickly releases the pet fur for self-cleaning. The handle is comfortable to hold. I LOVE LOVE LOVE that it comes with a protectant cover for the bristles when not in use. This keeps the brush bristles from being bent in a drawer or chewed by a cat when left out. I love this brush, the best slicker self-cleaning brush I've owned. The cats also enjoy it.

profile.title: Keeps your air fryer tidy
profile.text: These parchment liners are a really convenient way to make your air fryer experience as low maintenance and quick as possible.  It greatly reduces the time needed to clean your fryer after it’s used.  These are paper,  and although parchment is very resistant to scorching/fire, you do need to be mindful that they could catch on fire.  Stay close by and be careful using the highest settings on the fryer.  Overall though, these are quick and convenient.  Also great for lining round pans.

profile.title: Keeps manes tamed, and comfy to boot.
profile.text: This sleep cap was better than I expected in terms of comfort and functionality, although it left a bit to be desired in the style category.  Don’t get me wrong, I am not terribly experienced in terms of hair wraps, but I thought I would give it a try both for my curls and for protecting my blow outs.  When it arrived, I was immediately pleased with the silky interior, although there were a few loose threads.  These were not really an issue.  The cap was loose and comfortable, to the point I was not sure it would stay on during sleep or that my hair would stay contained.  Neither proved to be an issue.  I slept in it easily, my hair stayed in place, and I even wore it under my shower cap in the mornings to keep from getting the dreaded impression across my forehead from the shower cap elastic.  It worked really well, although I would recommend not splashing the face area if you choose to do this. The style issue I mentioned was that the way mine was cut, it did not look like a turban at all no matter how I turned it or tucked the corners in, but rather looked more like a cap with two edges. Not super attractive to be honest.  Hubby knew better than to do more than quietly give me a hard side eye the first time I wore it to bed though.  For the price point, this is a very comfortable and functional item. It is worth a try to see if it works for you to keep your hair looking great and save you time in the morning.

profile.title: I wish these had been around when i first got my air fryer!
profile.text: Sundays in my house are for chicken wings and football...so yesterday we slapped some wings into our Ninja with a parchment liner...my one note is that these are short, so be careful not to overfill the basket (smaller batches are better anyway).  But these liners did the trick...a simple spray and wipedown, instead of the typical scrubbing!  More time for football!

profile.title: Pleasantly surprised by this product.....
profile.text:
I've used the same aloe vera gel for a number of years but when it was discontinued, I had to find a substitute. Bipin's production criteria and list of ingredients were both in keeping with what I seek in this type of product. I know that some people are put off by the words "made in China" but I've learned that does not automatically mean a poor quality product or an ineffective one. And while this gel might not be the right one for everybody else, it is working for me and even better than the one it replaced.

I thought it reasonably priced. It was carefully shrink-wrapped to avoid any leakage, bottled in convenient size (box of two), and neither too runny nor too thick in consistency. Some reviewers mention an odor or aroma of some kind but I detected no such thing. Initially it seemed a bit wet in application but then was fully absorbed after a few seconds and left no sticky or gummy feeling whatsoever. This is a dream come true for my skin which seems to have become drier and more sensitive with age. I have used it frequently over several days and have passed the point where I'd encounter a bad reaction so I'm more confident now that I made the right choice. Too soon to tell if it will have a lasting positive impact but thus far, everything is in the plus column.

profile.title: Brush Head is not Very Good
profile.text:
I use microbrushes for painting fine details on models. Unfortunately, the heads on these brushes is not suited to this task. The head seems more like a tiny cotton swab than a brush. Brush head gets saturated and does not deposit paint in an even layer on the surface being painted. It's as if the brush head peels away, letting the stick surface touch the model and leaving streaks of no paint.
These may be very good for other applications, but for painting fine details they're not a good choice.

profile.title: Flimsy, but it works.
profile.text:
I got this because I volunteer at a cat shelter, and every morning we have to defur the cat trees in order to clean them, so I wanted something that could handle it. It did work rather well, but the handle is rather flimsy, and fell off as I was putting the brush into the compartment. I had to superglue it back on and it seemed fine afterwards. The compartment also easily falls apart -- though again it is meant to fall apart, but I think this is an issue with the quality of the plastic. Granted, this is at a cat shelter, so for one or two cats at home it should be more than manageable.

As for why I'm using past tense, that's because we had to get rid of it because another volunteer left it open and one of the cats peed on it, which is obviously not the manufacturers' fault. It did convince me to get another one in this style, though a pricier and (hopefully) better quality one.

I wish I could find the matching Body Wash & Lotion of this scent, it would make my entire year! It smells just like a gingerbread cookie but not too sweet & with a light perfect hint of spice. profile.title: Surprisingly happy with this purchase
profile.text: I am surprisingly happy with this purchase! I bought this wig because at my age, my hair is starting to break really easy & I seem to be shedding much more hair than usual. I usually go with wearing hair extensions but that is sometimes pretty hard on my already weakened hair. First of all, I have to mention that this wig is exactly as pictured. Color & all. I bought this wig in this style because I needed something to wear while doing physical duties at home & when I'm out & about. I usually don't buy synthethic wigs because most of the time you can tell that they are synthetic & end up looking just horrible. But I do have to say that this wig looks like & feels almost like real human hair, at least in my opinion. It is definitely a higher end synthetic, however I am not able to curl the hair at all. But that wasn't a big deal. The hair has plenty of waviness to it & I love the braids & the ponytail. I did trim it a bit  (about 3.5 inches) because it felt a bit heavy for me. I brushed it out & added a few more braids & redid the ponytail & it looks & feels great! But my head does get a little hot when wearing it & sometimes I get a bit itchy but I think that could be because I am new to wearing wigs & maybe just need to get used to it. Not sure. I also got this wig because it seems that Copper colored ones are not as abundant as the other colors out there & was in desperate need of this color. And what I love most about this wig is the price! For $20, I figured it was worth a try. Glad I did. Definitely a must have if you only need it for a costume party or for Comic-con. Not sure I am able to wear this wig all day everyday. Am still new to exploring the world of wigs so I am still on the hunt for Copper colored hair pieces, especially one I can wear all day, everyday & be able to curl & change the the hairstyles.

profile.title: WAY TOO SHARP! Not in a good way!
profile.text:
Normally having an item that’s mean to cut things that’s really sharp would be a good thing. But these are way too sharp. I tried to cut off the smallest little hang nail on my right hand (I’m right handed) & I barely even touched my skin & it sliced into the side of my finger. It’s like.. impossible just to clip off the skin you want to clip. There’s too dull & too sharp. There’s a perfect in between that isn’t dangerous. These are wayyyyyy too sharp. You’re going to end up taking off too much skin & getting infections. There’s a reason why $12-$20 cuticle cutters work so well.. & why they cost that much.. there’s a level of detail that needs to be put into these products to make sure they’re safe for all people to use & it costs
More money & takes more time… therefore costing a bit more. I don’t think I’d by these again. I like the metal tool that comes with this item.. so I’m going to keep them. But these will not be used on my skin. They’re just way too dangerous. It’s too easy to clip off too much skin & it’s too easy to get infections on your fingers. Be careful.

profile.title: Sharp Cuticle Pushing Tool Gouges Nails
profile.text: This product had many great reviews at the time of ordering in April 2021.  I put some cuticle eliminator on, waited the 45 seconds, and went to work on pushing back my cuticles.  I've used a bamboo pusher before and might switch back to those if I can't get the angle of this sharp product just right.  Both ends are sharp.  They did not sand the rounded edge as I would expect.  When I went to push the cuticle back it repeatedly gouged into my natural nails causing ridges.  I haven't done this in a very long time, but I know had I used a better brand or the bamboo stick style, I wouldn't have had to spend 45 minutes buffing my nails out so they didn't look worse than when I started.

profile.title: Removes stubborn makeup, even waterproof mascara!
profile.text: Love these cleansing pads. I typically use fragrance free body oil to remove eye makeup, but was happy to see same thing in a pad. I was worried it would irritate the eyes, but it didn't! I used one pad for both eyes to remove waterproof mascara and eyeliner. No irritation and it took everything off! Definitely recommend!

profile.title: Helps minimize inflammation
profile.text: I tend to breakout a lot especially week prior to menstrual period. These pimple patches do a great job in minimizing pimple size and inflammation. I put it on at night before bed and when I wake up in the morning, the pimple is almost gone. It has good adhesion, mine did not come off during sleep. I definitely recommend.

profile.title: I love this stuff
profile.text: I have purchase many face powder but this is perfect, it doesn't irritate my eyes like others have. Its diffently worth it. I will definetly be ordering again.

profile.title: Not great for mature skin
profile.text: Ingredients list met my needs, and I'll use it for when I'm applying eyeshadow (to collect any fallen pigment powder and brush away), but personally I don't like the way it looks on my skin (I'm almost 40). Looked great on my daughter's skin for Prom. Better for those with really light complexions, and youthful skin.

profile.title: Perfect for dreadlocks
profile.text: I know this is for pets, but a lot of people use lice combs, or flea combs for dreading hair. I've tried other flea pet combs over the years, so many brands, and they all break really easily, or the teeth bend/break. This one is quality, seriously! It's sturdy, perfect weight, and rounded so even ergonomically it's solid. I've gotten hours of use out of it and still haven't encountered any issues. A lot of comb teeth are also on the sharp side, not this one, it's great. Slightly rounded teeth, so I'm sure it's not going to be hard on your pets skin. I'll likely purchase another just to use on my cats, but for now I'm using mine for dreads -those of you who are looking for a good dread comb, I've used this on human, and synthetic hair with equally excellent results. Would recommend.

profile.title: Fabulous!
profile.text: I just tried this today....it's absolutely beautiful! I love the ease of blending, the sheerness, and the perfection it gives to my skin without being cakey, shiny or irritating. Being mature skinned I like a matte look, but not sparkly or falsely dewy. I also love the fact that it's buildable and it hides flaws, texture, but noncomodogenic. Definitely will buy again!

profile.title: Great manicure tool
profile.text: This manicure tool is absolutely awesome. I wouldn't recommend it for beginners necessarily but it is a very nice tool. If you handle these before then it may be okay. But I wouldn't recommend it for beginners.

profile.title: Not for me.
profile.text: The decals are nice but when they're placed onto the nail, it doesn't lay flush to the nail, which means they eventually "buckle" and  raise even with nail lacquer applied over top! You can only wear them...at best, about 2 days before you get problems with buckling!

profile.title: Great setting powder
profile.text:
For reference, I have combination skin that is very picky. I struggle with breakouts, dry skin, and redness.
This is a great setting powder. I tend to do my skin care routine and then do a very LIGHT dusting of this product before applying my foundation. This I put on my foundation, blush, and contour, and then apply the setting spray. I then finish with another SMALL dusting of this product using my moist beauty blender. The trick is to use a very small amount for a pore-less look.

profile.title: Nice price, poor quality
profile.text: I feel like this polish would be suited for a children's set. The bottles aren't small, but they do not contain much product. The colors are beautiful, but unfortunately I had chipping by the end of the day. Spending an hour on my nails for them to chip by the end of the day is a no go for me. This would be a decent set for someone to practice with since you get 15 bottles for around $20 at the time of purchase, but unfortunately it isn't very good quality.

profile.title: Good for extending but a bit challenging to apply
profile.text: This is a tan extender to use after you have already tanned. It deepens your color and adds richness. The scent is not bad, and it is a pretty large pump bottle for around $30 at the time of purchase. I do apply this product with a mitt like regular self tanners, and I use a beauty blender or brush on my hands, feet, and neck for a better blend. My only major issue with this is it goes on clear so its super challenging to apply it evenly to avoid streaking. However if you already have a base tan, this is less noticeable.

profile.title: Seriously cannot live without these
profile.text: I did not realize how much dead skin I had. Once using this product, it little comes off like little toilet paper rolls (I know gross). I usually use them on my husbands back. These are great to use before shaving to avoid getting ingrown hairs. I also use these once a week before applying self tanner. I use these after I have been in the shower for a few minutes and my skin has softened. Great product!

profile.title: Great affordable product
profile.text: My garbage skin care routine finally caught up to me, so after doing some research, I decided on this retinol serum. I use it in the evening on clean skin. I like that the product is vegan and non gmo. They product has a nice scent and a great  consistency. Since using this product, I feel as if my pores are smaller and my skin is more even overall with both color and lines. I will continue to use this product in my daily routine.

profile.title: Great starter set!
profile.text: I am by no means a professional. I just recently started derma rolling. I prefer to use the micro needle roller first. It isn’t the most comfortable feeling, but you get use to it. I do it while I am watching T.V. To distract myself. While rolling, I put the jade roller in the refrigerator. Once I finish with the micro needle, I apply hyaluronic acid, and then roll with the jade roller. It is SO SOOTHING. The roller has two sides- a large end for the planes of your face, and a small end to get in smaller areas like under your eyes. I only use the micro needle roller once a week-usually on Saturday nights. It does make your face a little red, but it goes away by morning. I use the jade roller a couple times a week, especially after stressful days. Just so you know, make sure to sterilize both rollers or you will have major breakouts from spreading bacteria around. I keep alcohol in a small spritzer to use on both before each use. The  packaging was sufficient, and I would feel comfortable giving it as a gift.

profile.title: Not for combo middle aged skin
profile.text: I have some spots that are a little oily, maybe a little patch of dry skin. I am 48 and I didn't love this and I wish I could because I need something more natural. I hate wearing makeup but a loose powder for when I do wear makeup to finish is a must for me. This did not flatter the fine lines I have at all. It is way to sheer for my skin type. Happy with the ingredients.

profile.title: It doesn't work
profile.text: For $100 I expect some great results, there was none with this. Plus side is that it didn't irritate my eyes. Having used the entire contents of this bottle I asked my lash lady if she saw any difference in my lashes and she said no.

profile.title: Why this tip!
profile.text: I use this kind of stuff all the time for my girls. My 9 yr old is obsessed with the brush kind. This wand is ridiculous! I absolutely hate how it goes on and it doesn't work anywhere near as well as the brush. Who decided this eye brush would be a good idea?! Stick with the mascara brush! It works perfectly, this doesn't!

profile.title: My runner up
profile.text: My girls and I have every fall/winter get dry, cracked, bleeding hands. I hate it, they hate it. I have a very expensive hand lotion that I use and it works like no other. I am so surprised at how well this works. It's thick, it does smell a little weird, even though it says unscented. We use it at night and there is a good change over the course of a few days. The price is excellent for the quality. I would pay more because having itchy, dry, scaly hands is miserable. This is only the second lotion I have found that works on all of us.

profile.title: Not medium coverage
profile.text: I have some light sun spots and I like full coverage foundations. This is light coverage. I had to apply stick over this. I also don't like the way my skin feels after a couple hours, it just feels kind of tacky... weird. Just not a fan. This isn't for middle aged skin.

profile.title: It's nothing special
profile.text: I wanted to try this out because my hair is thinning and it goes through a lot every 6-7 weeks. The product itself smells good but I don't see anything special or different about this and for the cost, it's not justified at all. I followed up with the conditioner.

profile.title: Great for lashes
profile.text: I got a lash lift and was told to use castor oil. I have been applying it to my lashes everyday. It has helped keep my lashes from getting brittle or going wonky. I haven't tried it for anything else but I'm very happy with the non oily results on my lashes.

profile.title: Good size
profile.text: I got this for my 8 yr old to wash with her face soap. She has been getting bumps and I'm not sure if it's from the sweat from the facemasks or from hormones. This is a great size for her and I like that it's gentle but it's not her hands washing her face. We have one in her bathroom, mine and we have 2 spare. It's great

profile.title: Like the 2 pack
profile.text: I got one for each of my girls. I like the silicone. I use something similar without whatever is in the middle. That is why I gave it 3 stars. I don't like the middle part. It takes forever to get the soap out, also squeezing it out and lastly I hate how long it seems to take to dry out. I'm worried about it smelling and collecting bacteria. Both my girls like this but they are used to washing with silicone.

It’s very fine so be aware it will kind of get all over your desk or vanity, or your lap, so you might want to put a towel down if you’re trying to keep clothes nice.

profile.title: Fail
profile.text:
These are not easy to use at all.
They pull the hair.

profile.title: They do work
profile.text: There really aren’t enough curlers. If all of them were the same good quality, I’d say you are lacking 5-6 to finish a head with the appropriate amount of hair in each curler. My hair is quite long but not thick at all. Once you add on the 3-4 that quality control missed, you are now lacking up to 10 curlers. The curlers that should have been trashed have excess material that catches your hair during application and removal so they pull your hair out. Some only have one side messed up so you just have to make sure the messy part is at the bottom. Just order 2 packs so you have enough good quality ones to use. Application is pretty easy, even for someone like me with no hair talent. My hair is hard to keep curl in and these curls lasted 2 days on freshly washed hair with some product. I did not use any heated or cold air. Pic shows a good (pink) curler vs a bad (orange) one.

I'm someone who can't curl my pin straight hair without loads of mousse and hair spray to keep it in place,with these,I don't even need any spray or mousse and my curls lasted at least 2 full days.

profile.title: Decent product
profile.text:
I bought this item in hopes of having natural looking beach waves without having to use heat. I have long pin-straight hair. I had almost enough rollers to use on all of my hair (1-2 more rollers would’ve been perfect). I used the roller as instructed to with partially damp here. I felt like it made my hair slightly staticky which isn’t the norm for me. It definitely gave me curls but I wouldn’t call them natural looking beach curls.

The seller/customer service is GREAT! I was responded to quickly when I contacted them about using this item. Overall it’s a decent purchase. If you’re looking for beach waves I wouldn’t recommend this item but if you’re looking for curls that are made without using heat, I’d say give this item a try.

Then after that you rinse it with soap and water, it literally washed half the black coloring off right off the bat. The picture above is less than 24 hrs after putting them on. One they look like someone just used a marker to draw on you, nothing real looking about it but also just a pain compared to using an actual marker cause you gotta keep the spot from moving to much otherwise the stencil moves and can bleed the design like what happened on the fish as the end of my arm. Overall save your money, atleast henna looks like it's In your skin this doesn't look or act anything like that.

profile.title: Lovely, but I can’t get the part to work for me.
profile.text: I bought a blonde Hair Cube wig for Halloween and I love it. I decided to get a brown one (my actual hair color) that is longer than my hair. I ordered the Ombré brown wig. The hair is beautiful, but the center part look’s completely fake on my head. I’m sending it back and getting a similar one with bangs. My blonde one has bangs and it looks like real hair. This one would be fine if I wanted to wear a fabric headband to cover the center part, but I don’t want to always do that. The hair itself is gorgeous…I love the curls and the color.

profile.title: I can work with this!
profile.text: I was able to cut the front folded rubber hairline off of this and make it blend fairly well with having a bit of my natural hair pulled out at the hairline. There is still a visible line because as you know, it's not lace, but a thin piece of rubber simulated scalp, so there's an edge, but on this wig I got lucky that the edge layed flat, so even though there's a line, it's a flat line as opposed to a lifted line which would look much more obvious. I've worn it in public, around my family and no one noticed it's a wig. It passed my test! I did sew wig combs in the sides and back though because the first time I wore it, there was slippage (even though I wore it with a wig grip), but since sewing on the combs, it doesn't budge. The hair itself is really pretty. It does shed quite a bit, but so does my natural hair. I'm used to it. It was fine putting some heat on it, just be careful...not too hot. Of course it tangles after wearing it for a day, but tangles come out just fine as long as you're gentle. The style of the hair is so pretty, and if you don't mind working with it a little (cutting the rubber, plucking the part, adding combs, etc.), it's worth the cost and has the potential to look fairly natural. Sorry about the graininess of the photo due to low lighting. Other photos I took made the wig take on a reddish hue, so I didn't post those here, but it truly is a light/medium brown with darker (not black) roots.

profile.title: Cute with a couple issues
profile.text:
This wig looks really cute, and I was able to get it to mostly blend with my natural gray hair around my face and with my widow's peak, which is pretty hard to blend in with a lot of wigs. I don't like to use any kind of glue or tape, so I depend on a wig grip and bobby pins to hold everything in place. This fit my head pretty well, and I have an average size head, but I think slightly larger heads would fit too. I'm not sure it would do too well if you have really long and thick hair, as it might take up too much space in the cap. When I had it on, I didn't notice the tracks, but when it was off I thought they were pretty noticable, and I was a little worried. Also you know how on some wigs, they add those short annoying hairs that inevitably end up poking through the longer ones and looking weird? Yep, I noticed the hair towards the back of the cap does that. Coincidentally, that's the place where the tracks are most visible as well.
The thing I like about it, is the actual hair, and the color, the texture, and the ability to flip it from side to side (even though it's parted in the middle. The style of it is most like my natural hair of any wig that I've purchased so far. I did add some dry shampoo. The color looks really awesome indoors. Outside in the daylight, it is a little much. It looks pretty white outdoors, but has a nice silvery-gray color indoors. So there are some negatives, but I could see wearing this as a daily wear wig. It didn't tangle too badly after a full day of wear... even with me running my fingers through it and flipping it like I do. I was easily able to tidy it up by finger combing at the end of the day. I wish the back side was slightly longer because the front that frames your face is longer and the waves in the back can look a little shaggy compared to the slightly curlier waves in the front. Overall, it's still cute, but I think the price is too much for this short wig. It should be closer to the $20 range. I'd love to own a 22-24" version of this in the same color or even a slightly darker gray or gray mix.

profile.title: Cute and comfortable
profile.text: This could totally pass as my own hair. I had to trim the bangs and fix the curl a bit (although it didn't take the heat of the curler very well... it wanted to straighten). It's not too difficult to work with. It really looks like how my hair used to many years ago when I had bangs. The hair is soft and wasn't too shiney. I sprayed a little dry shampoo on it anyway. I think a lot of people could get away with wearing this wig undetected. It could use a clip in the back. It has the standard adjustable straps, but a clip would just add that lil bit of extra security. I might add one. They're cheap enough, and could I see myself wearing this one daily, so I definitely want it secure. Overall, I love it.

profile.title: Really good
profile.text: These are great loofas. The braid is thick and sturdy and the material is just the right amount of rough and softness put together. It exfoliâtes well without scratching and the softness isn’t dull to the point where the soap won’t lather. Honestly I’ve bought these twice in the past two years because their shelf life is good and long enough and I haven’t experienced any type of molding with them (Compared to other brands). The only reason I won’t give it 5 stars is because after a few uses, like the consistent action of lathering up the soap and then wringing it out, the braids begin to loosen and it almost looks like all it’s feathers are plucked and disheveled lol (if that makes sense, use your imagination). But this is months down the line and by that time it’s ready to be switch it out so really it’s not all that bad.

profile.text:
Ok I feel dumb that I actually thought this would give a lil tint to my grays… all it did was make ‘em MORE noticeable. I shoulda just went to Sally’s and got my dang hair color!! LOL
BUT, I love everything else about the product!! It does smell really good but also my retwists NEVER looked so amazing. I feel like EVERY hair is in place, and that’s been a hard achievement because my hair is super soft. When I’m doing my retwist, I normally feel my hair kind of already unraveling even after clipping in place to secure and putting in a braided style. Not today. A little goes a loooong way. Definitely will repurchase. This is my new “thing”.

Definitely worth the money especially with the 50% off coupon I added to checkout!!!!

profile.title: Good body wash but the scent is very low
profile.text:
As most my reviews on body wash, I always state; hard water takes more soap then moderate to soft water, to lather. In this case, I can use very little, like maybe a bit less than a table spoon on my loofah (yes I do use one) and can lather this Greek bod from toes to head no problem.

The smell is there but for me, not very strong at all. I like the scent and whish it was a bit stronger. This is not a deodorant soap, so it does not leave a scent on the skin after drying off. Though it does clean very well and rinses off with ease. There is no after slime or weird tacky feeling. The soap does have beads in it, so if you are a hands and soap person, you will like that.

The scent is difficult to describe so I won't try..

This stuff will last a long time as it takes very little, for medium water, not hard or soft water, just in the middle, to lather and clean.

profile.title: The whole set works great
profile.text: I have no complaints, and neither does my daughter, whose hair I use this on. The big brush is excellent at detangling, and the rest of them are excellent at their various specific jobs. Sure, they're a bit flimsier than other brush sets, with thinner, cheaper plastic, but I've used worse, and they're not bad enough to bend under normal pressure or fall apart. They're meant to be inexpensive brushes, and that's whattl they do well. I recommend if you need an extra brush set. If you want a really long-term, more permanent set, probably look for others, but these should still last a good while.

profile.title: work great
profile.text: This brush set includes a paddle brush, style brush, round brush, pointed tail comb, and cleaning tool. I rarely use the tail comb and instead prefer the round and paddle brushes, which are both excellent. These work great on both thick and long hair, and my partner had no trouble with them. The brushes are well-packaged and are simple to use due to their small weight. Furthermore, a single brush might now cost around $5 at the pharmacy. Having said that, this collection represents excellent value. For style, I also enjoy the pointed comb. The brush cleaning tool, like the rest of the kit, is made of cheap plastic, yet it is pure brilliance.

profile.title: Good hair ties
profile.text: These are fantastic. Regular ones would always stretch out and break on me, forcing me to knot them together until I could get to a new one. I've been using 1 for several weeks now with no signs of ripping. The twin elastic strands are appropriate for all hair types. A jumbled bund is simple to make using the two strands. Furthermore, the multiple strands make the ties incredibly strong, so you don't have to wrap it around your hair too many times. I can knot one strand of hair and then do something else with the other strand without losing control of my hands. Excellent idea, and it's incredibly adaptable. The bonds are quite strong.

profile.title: Lightweight and easy to grip and use!
profile.text:
This is a nice brush set with a paddle brush, styling brush, round brush, pointed tail comb, and cleaning tool. I don’t particularly use the tail comb and use the round brush and paddle brush mainly and they are both perfect. These can easily be used on thick and long hair as well as my girlfriend had no problems using them either.

They are all made of plastic and it feels like a cheap plastic. But that is what makes this set half the price of a normal set at the store and much more lightweight that some of them. I mean $11 is the price for like two brushes at the store these days. That being said, they don’t seem to break under normal pressure when brushing your hair either.

Overall, I would recommend this set to anyone as I am really happy with it so far.

profile.title: Ears not pierced for earrings! Nicked skin
profile.text:
Why drill a hole from back of the ear and a separate one on the front, if they don’t connect? It’s just to give the appearance that the hole is drilled all the way through. It is advertised as earring display but depending on how the hole was drilled at factory, you can’t use it without bending/damaging the wire on the earring.

I returned one for that issue plus blotchy skin finish. Replacement arrived today with same ear issue PLUS deformed ear. The skin finish is perfect on the replacement.

It’s a beautiful mannequin and perfect size. The price is good for how beautiful it is but it seems that the defective issue is a recurring theme. I’m sad not giving it five stars but I want to be honest in my review to inform others of the potential issues. If you don’t need it for earrings display, buy it! It’s beautiful.

I will be returning it and looking at other options.

profile.title: Best thing there is for dry cracked feet!!!!
profile.text: I wish I would have taken before and after photos!!!! I probably have the driest feet in the world!!! No matter what I do, or use... they stay dry and still crack..sometimes crack so bad they bleed ok... it’s that serious... especially in winter and summer months.... I have literally probably tried everything on the market. Even after a professional “luxury” pedicure, 2 days later, my feet are cracking again!!! But let me tell you!!!! THIS WORKS!!! Not only did it smooth my rough heels out... they stay that way!!!! The first time I used it, I didn’t have to do it again for at least 2 weeks!!!! It was very easy to use, and only took about 5 minutes of scrubbing to do both feet!!! And, to top it all off, it made them soft too!!! This is not your average pumice stone!!! profile.title: Insanely Messy
profile.text: I do a lot of sensory stuff for my kid (slime, play dough, etc.) so I thought this might be a fun new texture. He loved it, but it was so messy we stopped in the middle of playing with it to throw it away. I assumed that it would stick together somewhat but it did not. Sure, it’s cleaner than actual sand but I’m not sure how you can put “no mess” on the packaging in good conscience. It’s impossible to sweep it, use a wet wipe, or even pick up with your hands since it compacts when you touch it. We had to use the vaccum and then wash the toys we were playing in it with. I might only recommend this if you’re gonna play with it in the bath tub, then you can just spray your kid down when they’re done. It would also make a great revenge gift :)

profile.title: Really anti-climatic and difficult to clean up
profile.text: I found this to be shockingly boring. It does much less than kinetic sand (and is much harder to clean up as it doesn't stick to itself).  You smoosh it into a little ball and then the ball expands a bit.  But that's it.  There's a lot of different kinetic toys and this is my least favorite.  It isn't really moldable; it doesn't feel great. I really don't get it at all.

profile.title: says it's adjustable?
profile.text: this bonnet is smarter than me.  it says it's adjustable - i gave up trying to figure that out.  it's very large and in no way makes it through night on my head.  i'm still giving it 4 stars though because if you can figure that adjusting things, i'm sure it's great.  but it does also come with 2 satin scrunchies that are the absolute best for sleeping!  i love them.  they are great for sleeping and keeping your hair looking great.  i pull my hair back or up every night but rubber bands are really terrible for it, because they will get tangled up.  so these satin scrunches really don't do that, they are much smoother and gentler on your hair.  i'm sure i'll keep trying to adjust the bonnet.  i do like wearing them when i use oils in my hair, or if i go to bed with wet hair to protect my pillow and keep my head warm.  if i can't figure it out, well at least i got two awesome scrunchies for sleeping.

profile.title: not as effective as some of the others
profile.text: i'm a big fan of hydrocolloid patches - i've tried at least 5 different brands at this point and have had many different experiences.  my experience with these have been a bit slower than with the others.  with some of the others they help to bring the blemish to the top and then promote healing.  these did not seem to help in the progression process, it does however seem to help with the healing process. basically for me, these seem to work better only once the zit is popped - whereas some others seem to help you make it poppable and then heal and some of the others even help to stop it from ever even becoming a zit.  so they have some decent benefits, just not all of the benefits of some of the others.

profile.title: use in a ventilated space!
profile.text:
first the elephant in the room - read the ingredients and you will see there is formaldehyde. technically this is terrible but it is somewhat manageable. be in a ventilated space. personally i turn the bathroom fan on while i am using it for the whole process - especially during the flat iron part. i also turn on a regular floor fan pointed into the bathroom, whatever i can do to keep the air moving.

ok - now that we have covered that - the actual product. it's sooooo easy to use. the process is so simple and easy. the directions are super easy to understand and follow and there are pictures included. it's pretty quick - you can get through it all within an hour once you get started on the actual product. just follow the directions.

then for maintenance between treatments there is a shampoo and conditioner provided. these are EXTREMELY thick! like the conditioner is so crazy thick it's almost too difficult to get it out of the bottle. it's a workout. but it's all good to help maintain though.

now - the results. i'm not disappointed at all. i know it's working. it's not a crazy perma-straight situation though. this is NOT salon results. let me repeat that ... NOT salon results. i have super natural curly hair - i can still wash my hair curly. the same amount of curls as i have always had. when i do wear it curly though, i also still have the same amount of frizz. it's sad and true. that said though - it's when wear it straight that the product shows it's worth! the picture i have posted it right after coming after getting caught in the rain. in the past my hair would just revert back to the full on curl, no waves just the game of 'how big is my hair gonna grow?' watch party. this time though ... i ended up with a style that i actually like! something i could easily still get away with wearing for the rest of the day/evening. as rainy and muggy as it has been lately - i can dig this and appreciate it through and through.

so all that said - do i wish it did a bit more for the curly hair frizz ... yes. but for the price and the fact that i will probably get 4 treatments out of this set - i think the system is worth for the investment - cost and time.

profile.title: i think it works
profile.text: this is the 3rd system i've tried in around 5 months - and i finally feel like something is working.  my hair is truly starting to feel a bit thicker, and some of the thinner spots appear to be a little less thin.  i wish i had some super profound before and after photos - i do not, a lot of it is in how my hair feels, and to be honest the results are slow coming - i might have a very drastic result in 6 months, and i would definitely update then, but for now i feel gradual changes and i am thrilled about it.  age and stress have thinned my hair a ton - i hate it, so any iota of added thickness is going to be thrilling for me.  now ... i just need to find a way for all of the new hairs to stop growing in gray.

My hair with a blow dryer and what not gets too dry and adding spray conditioner makes it too greasy. But combing that wet hair to dry is NO fun. Until I found this. This is my third one. Its just straight little pieces of short plastic. It works though and I always inspect my brush for hair loss. Some how some way this works perfect with very little hair loss. And my hair dries great after using this. Look in all honesty I have no idea how it works so well. But I am real glad I found it. No tangles , no getting hair pulled out and fabulous looking hair drying naturally ! And I have $30 plus brushes that don't come close to this inexpensive jewel !  Wish everything was like that ! I hope that this may have been helpful !

profile.title: These are reusable
profile.text: I love these little sponges because they can be cleaned and used again. I also love that they expand when wet and the very small size makes them easier to clean than a normal sized beauty sponge. Compared to the old fashioned white wedges these are definitely a couple steps up. The Ajoke wedges are smaller than the generic brand wedges when dry. I provided a picture for comparison.  There is also a picture to compare the size of a damp Ajoke wedge to the size of a dry generic brand wedge. The damp Ajoke wedge is larger next to the generic brand. Finally, an additional picture is provided to observe the finish that the Ajoke sponges gives when used damp to apply foundation and concealer.

profile.title: These Don't Fall Apart

profile.title: Small Black Makeup Sponges
profile.text: Ajoke Makeup sponges are half the size of other makeup sponges that I have bought in the past. I like the firm soft feel of the sponges when they are dry. When I wet one, it expanded in size about 20% to a more useful size and became softer and less firm, but didn't pill when I rubbed the sponge. The sponge did shrink back almost to the original size when fully dry, but was still softer. There was no smell emanating from either the plastic jar that the sponges were packaged, or the sponges themselves.

profile.title: Cegsin Hair Brush
profile.text: Cegsin Hair Brush is the widest hair brush I have ever used. It is too large to pack in a purse and takes up a lot of room in a drawer. I guess this brush is intended to be used with a blow dryer because of the holes in the back and slight curvature.  The brush is light weight plastic, but the bristles didn't pull my hair and they all have their tips intact. The combs and clips look cheap but work. I would expect a set like this at a dollar store.

profile.title: Super soft sponges
profile.text: These wedges are extremely soft. and easy to hold. They are about the same texture as a beauty blender. Perfect size to use with nail polish and under eye concealer. They came in a little jar as well so I don't have to worry about another bag in my vanity drawers. Wonderful find

profile.title: Not very successful
profile.text:
I applied a thick coat of the remover after buffing the top coat off of these nails. I let it sit longer than recommended. The polish would not scrape off after. It did soften it, some of the polish did come off, and it really softened the artificial nails as you can tell. I have not tried it on natural nails yet, but will update when I do.

The latex tape is similar to tacky glue. I hoped to use it around my nails before polishing them to make clean up easy, but I don't think it will peel off as well with cured polish over it.

profile.title: Perfect for a make up kit
profile.text: I like that these are small enough to use in creases but big enough to hold and navigate. The sponges seem to absorb a good amount of product but do leave a skin like finish.

profile.title: No Complaints!
profile.text:
These sponges are awesome - small, dense and soft to the touch. They have worked well applying my CC cream so far and I’m sure I’ll find some other uses, too.

I personally love the smaller size - they allow for more precision, especially around the eye area. I’d absolutely recommend!

profile.title: Great for Halloween makeup
profile.text: Got these to apply Halloween makeup and glowing body paint. They work really well for this whether wet or dry. Great value pack!

profile.title: Too funny!

The accessories are really great, considering the price and the wig is pretty decent. It does require a bit of fixing from being shipped but that didn't take a lot of work. Perfect for dress- up!

profile.title: Good brush set
profile.text: The hair brush is a nice set the paddle brush is smaller size as you can tell by the picture to the wet brush.  However is a good brush and i haven't had a problem with it..  The large comb is very nice for brushing out wet hair.  The detailing comb is good for sectioning out hair however do to the small handle it is hard to hold.  The water sprayer is very nice and has a good mist.  However the worst brush is the red one doesn't go into my hair at all and haven't had the greatest time trying to get that brush to work, that is my worst brush out of the set for me.

profile.title: Good for cleaning paws
profile.text: The product is very easy to use and easy to clean your dogs feet.  However make sure it will fit your dog feet.  Our 65lb pitbull it worked on however our 92 lbs Doberman feet were barely too big.  However it kinda worked.  Does come with a little towel so they can get clean feet during a bath or after a hike.  Was very useful

profile.title: Good tan
profile.text: It is a great foam that comes out very easy that comes out very dark.  So it makes it easy to apply so it doesnt take a lot of time to apply.  Does give you a nice tan.  However do not put heavy lotion and thick socks on to moisturize you feet because you will end up with a line like me.

profile.title: Great make up sponges.
profile.text: I got these for my wife and she enjoys using them. They are a little stiff right out of the package, but if you wash them before using they soften up quite a bit. She said they are absorbent enough to use with liquids like foundation, but do not do quite as well with the powders. However washing the sponges to soften them helps the powder stay on them better. They are smaller than a lot of other make up sponge brands so they are convenient for travel and take up less space when packing. After a while the foundation stops washing out, but because of the durable materials she is getting about double the amount of uses she gets with other sponges.

profile.title: Great idea. but..
profile.text: I got this kit for my wife as a gift and it really didn't work for her. The color matched pretty well, but it wasn't Grey/Brown like it said on the package, it was just a medium grown with a very slight reddish tint. The stencils were way to big for her face, and did not match the shape of her brows at all. The kit is messy to use, and pretty tough to wash off once applied. She plans on using the individual items in the future, but as a kit this did not meet expectations.

profile.title: Perfect for Body Paint
profile.text: Got these to use for cosplay when I need to use body paint. I appreciate how all the sponges came in a little jar. It’s more attractive and storage is easier. In terms of body paint they can be used for that great, smooth coverage.

profile.title: foam sponges
profile.text: I use sponge wedges to put liquid makeup on my face, but these sponges are just not wide enough to cover the makeup bottle, so I end up trying to pour the makeup onto the sponge and make a mess.  Other than that these sponges do spread makeup onto my face really well.  I do like the plastic jar they are packed in, but a safety seal would be beneficial.  At the time of this writing $6.99 for 20 washable, reusable sponges is a good price.

profile.title: Color stays put all day eyebrow kit
profile.text: Nice dark brown, medium brown eyebrow stamp kit.  I like having 2 different colors so I can blend how I like.  Each end has the color clearly marked.  The color stayed until I removed it in the evening with soap and water.  The 24 plastic stencils are easy enough to hold onto while applying the color, and give me many options of eyebrow styles.  Great for sparce areas, I even put the color on a few grey hairs at the sides of my temples.  I'm still working at using the hair trimmer.

profile.title: a lot of brow shapes
profile.text: I like the different eyebrow shape stencils in this pack. I found a few I thought would fit my face. Still experimenting with the powder, it gives a natural tone to my eyebrows.  The 2 different eye shadow shimmer sticks are really nice, I put the white color just under my eyebrow to help open up my eyes.  The brow stick helps me keep the eyebrows even.

profile.title: OMG the measurments!
profile.text:
So I bought these lip balm containers about a year ago and because of either laziness or trepidation (really it was the latter) it took me this long to create a label for them. I used canva to create the label, printed it on vinyl sticker paper and a cricut machine to cut it once it was printed. It sounds easy peezy right? No! The SIZE of the tube was the problem! No matter how many you tube videos I watched nobody had this size tube and I went through I don't know how many pages (plain paper, mind you) printing out a sample until I got the measurements right. So for those of you who want to do the same (yes I am selling lip balm and needed a label for retail) the correct measurement is 1.6x2.0... the height will give you just enough room to clear both the top and the turn circle (or whatever its called) at the bottom. The width however is just shy of touching. you can even expand it to 2.1 if you want your label to overlap.
Overall I like the tubes, I haven't had any problem with them other than the fact that they are truly small, but they're sturdy and have very little leakage, they are a good deal for the price.
But remember, if you're selling your lip balms or just want to pretty it up with a label, the measurements are 1.6x2.0.
Enjoy!

profile.title: This product does what is claims to do
profile.text: Advertising experts say you have to see or hear an ad at least seven times before you start considering it.  I must have seen the Lume ad at least that many times before I finally broke down and bought it.  Two aspects of their claim really intrigued me.  First of all, they said you could use it on any part of your body, not just armpits.  Second, they said it fights odor for 72 hours.  I had to try this stuff!  I wish it cost a little lest, but after buying, I have become hooked.  I don't think I'll ever go back to other deodorants again!  I have tried most of the scents, and have several tubes in the bathroom right now.  My shoes no longer stink, but now smell like the delicate scent of Lume.  All day long, I smell like Lume, rather than BO--all over my body.  I have not put it to the 72 hour test.  I can't bring myself to go that long, but it definitely works for 24 hours.  I wake up the next morning with some sweat, but no stench or BO.

**UPDATE 09/22/21** I now know what the smell reminds me of. Most modern parents know what a diaper genie is and what it smells like after it has been used for a while. profile.title: Do not recommend
profile.text:
UPDATE: Now that the weather has gotten warmer, this really does not work for me at all. I do not recommend it on any level. The price point is really ridiculous for the quality. Don't waste your dollars.

Power: Lasts the day for me (as in from morning to night, not 24 hours) -- note that I am not very sweaty person and do not have a bad issue with body odor, so it isn't that impressive. So, it is better than some of the other natural deodorants for sure, but it is not magic or super powerful and I cannot imagine that it would last someone 48 or 72 hours. I only used it on pits so that is what I am referring to.

Scent: The scent is where this loses a lot of points for me. It just does not smell good. It is not so bad that I will not continue to use it up, but it is a definite down side.

Consistency: This comes in a traditional deodorant dispenser, yet it is a cream that pops up through three holes. You have no choice but to rub it in like lotion, and the amount that comes out of the 3 holes all at once is too much. I only need 2 because I only use it for pits only. As far as putting it on, it does rub right in and then it does not feel like you have anything on you. Not any annoying sensation on the skin.

Overall impression: Would maybe buy again in another scent if the price were 1/2 what it is. It is just not special enough to pay this much for it again. Also, I think the applicator is pointless and it should simply be in the lotion tube, especially if they want to advertise right on the package that it can be used on other parts of the body. It seems unsanitary the idea of rolling this traditional deodorant applicator on your foot then popping it onto your armpit. Again, this scent is disappointing and I would not want to buy it again. It does provide me with 1 day's worth of coverage.

profile.title: Inconsistent results
profile.text: It works great for my crotch area,  less great for my armpits.  Certain scents seem to work less than others (for instance,  I don't even bother with Lavender Sage because I start to stink within a few hours. But jasmine rose has lasted 48 hrs)... of course I'm not sure if that's a scent thing or just inconsistency in the product.  Overall I like the product.  I smell less than I did before using it.  Just feel like the results are inconsistent.

profile.title: My 3 reasons not to buy. (Everyone is different go for gold sweetheart)
profile.text:
Although I love the commercials because they are hilarious and ultimately what got me to try the product, it was not successful for me. I got 3 varieties in the only scents they had available. Here are my views:
1.) The stick deoderant comes out as a cream so you get way too much at one time, and the hard plastic of the applicator was unpleasant.
2.) The product stays wet on your skin no matter where you apply. I tried it for 7 days in a row to get an honest impression. My armpits were left slippery and wet after every application until I washed it off. I experimented with losing less of the Lume and I got similiar results regardless of how much I put on.
3.) The scents that I got were very old-lady smelling and once I got to really moving the scent mixed with my natural body odor actually left me smelling worse.

profile.title: Under boob & stinky teenage boys
profile.text:
Why yes, I did just pay $18 for 1 stick of deodorant. That's how good this stuff is. I normally buy from Lumes website but they are insanely slow to ship and they're headquartered in my city. I needed this yesterday so I had to buy on Amazon. My 14yo son is stinky. I believe this to be true for most teenage boys. However this stuff solved that problem. Because it works for extra hours, it helps the forgetful kids. I haven't gagged at the smell of my son since we found this stuff. Buy this, lots of it, if you have stinky boys.
Second, let's talk big boobs: I've got 'em. It's super hard to keep the under boob area dry & chafing free in 100° summers. This does not stop sweat - but it does stop the smell & most importantly the red chafing that goes along with it. I have very sensitive skin & have tried 'all the things' to cure my constant red, chafing & sometimes yeast infected under boobs - including Dr prescribed ointments. This did it when nothing else does.
I will admit this stuff is ridiculously expensive. It doesn't smell pretty. The shipping is slow direct from them. They've messed up 2 of my orders (not Amazon) But for the 2 reasons I stated above (teenagers & underboobs), I will continue to purchase this in all forms & scents.

profile.title: The holy grail of natural deodorant
profile.text:
Look no further, this is the one! I decided to make the swap to a cleaner more healthy lifestyle about 10 years. Since then finding a replacement deodorant has been my biggest challenge. I have a graveyard of expensive deodorants and homemade concoctions. They either caused painful irritation from the baking soda or gave no body odor coverage. I first ordered Lúme about 3 years ago and I haven’t looked back. Jasmine Rose is my favorite scent but they are all great. I have done HIIT workouts and survived to hot humid Alabama heat with still no stinky smell. It’s important to remember this is a deodorant only, not an antiperspirant. It don’t find that to be an issue for me. I have found that if I shower at night I need to apply the deodorant before going to bed or you will know you haven’t come morning. I reapply after every shower or swimming. Unlike deodorants like secret this deodorant easily washes away, which is a good thing.

Some thing to consider when switching from traditional deodorants to natural options. Even with baking soda free options there might be a detoxing period where you may feel some irritation. Especially, if you’ve used most name brands for years. I did not have this problem with Lúme, but that doesn’t mean someone else won’t. If irritation or rash happens there are some natural detoxes you can apply to help speed up the process.

profile.title: Don’t buy on here buy from LUME
profile.text: I’ve been using LUME for some time now after using the regular old spice deodorant for a long time. I developed a rash reaction to aluminum deodorants when I was 17 (28 now) and where I liked the old spice smell it did not last throughout the day. LUME isn’t perfect and I don’t think Is 72hr worthy but for a whole day it does the best job for any natural deodorant I’ve ever used. Looking at these reviews I wonder if they got bad product from sitting in Amazon warehouses or from another seller. Mine never looked like gray goop or caused a rash. I’ve never bought it on here. Lûmes site is cheaper too if you just do the 2 pack with a subscription.
