profile.title: The smell was absolutely unbearable for me
profile.text: I read the reviews like most likely did.  I didn't have any particular physical needs with regard to sweating, and just wanted to maintain that "shower fresh" feeling throughout the day. My deodorant and feminine spray wasn't accomplishing this. So, I purchased the unscented roller. Honestly, it worked okay to get me through much of my day, but the smell was so unbearable, I couldn't stand to use it after showering. After a couple of weeks, I had to abandon it. I kept trying to figure out what the smell resembled and reminded me of? I finally realized that I used to be bothered by deer eating all my flowers at my home due to my proximity to the forest. To keep them at bay, I used a spray on the plants that was a deterrent. It kept them away from the blooms and worked wonderfully. However, the smell was unbearable. I learned to spray it late at night to spare my neighbors. Then it dawned on me...that's what this deodorant smells like! I just couldn't tolerate it. I threw it out.  A waste for me. I hope you have better luck!

profile.title: IMPRESSED!!
profile.text: I have tried to switch over to natural/no aluminum deodorants for years. I’ve tried many brands and just could handle the “stinky phase”. There’s no “stinky phase” with Lumē. I’m honestly in disbelief. I wanted to give it about a week before leaving a product review. I do yoga every morning and have been hot in summer commuting. I’m amazed that it keeps me feeling dry and there’s no BO smell. Up to this point I had been using Dove. The scent of this is very mild, which I prefer, in fact once it’s been on you really can’t smell anything. I only apply it after my nightly shower and just the smallest amount (this is important). You also need to let it completely dry before touching it to any clothing to prevent marking, but I haven’t noticed dark staining that other reviews mention, and I have put it on while wearing a white tank. Again, use the smallest amount, that’s all you need.

profile.title: Positively works for me
profile.text: It's not exactly a "bay rum" scent, which I'm quite familiar with from traditional wet shaving products, but its not at all unpleasant.  What I can say is that many  brands of over the counter deodorants can give me minor rashes.  Lume has eliminated that entirely without sacrificing odor control effectiveness.  It seems to last easily as long as many "48 hour" products I've tried at the grocery store but without the aluminum and occasional rash.  In fact, I brought a stick with me on a recent two week camping trip around the American Southwest (Bryce, Zion, Escalante, North Rim etc.) where I did not always have access to a daily shower.  Lume performed exceedingly well and though it might not have kept me as "powdery dry" feeling as some over the counter brands, it did not disappoint in the.......ummmmm......."BO control" department.....to put it indelicately.  Great product and I just ordered a few more to try some other scents.

profile.title: What is that smell
profile.text:
I spent two days trying to figure out what the smell reminded me of. Let's just say it has a major gag effect.
I figured out the smell and NEED to share it with you before you order some of this 17 dollar gag-producing deodorant that once it is on it is impossible to get away from. Note to future self... smell first put on second.
Here is the smell:
Many many years ago I went on a multiple-day mission in Afghanistan. There were no showers. On the last night, I crawled into my sleeping bag and tucked in. I enjoy my nose in to keep it warm. But not on this night. I took one whiff of my unbathed body and gagged, immediately sticking my nose out of the bag of old sour body odor. This is the smell of this deodorant.
I didn't buy deodorant to make myself smell like I just returned from a hot sticky long mission. I wanted something a bit less body odor and a bit more pleasant.
I would discourage anyone with the ability to still smell to avoid this stuff.

profile.title: How is Bay Rum Popular it smells like rotten eggs!
profile.text:
I’ve been a Lumé user since Spring of 2020. I like the deodorant because most “natural” deodorants really irritate my sensitive skin where it’s unbearable and anything that’s aluminum based destroys my underarms. The formula of this is nice, I don’t find it to clump in my underarm hair like other deodorants do. It goes on smooth and seems to absorb into my arm pits nicely.

Alright so here’s the reasons I scored Lumé Bay Rum so poorly:

I’ve been continuously disappointed because any scent that I like, they end up discontinuing. 😭 First it was Blue Spruce or Juniper something that then morphed into Juniper Breeze and then that just disappeared.

I was in a bind in June and Bay Rum was the fastest scent that could ship so I tried that one. I figured since it was so popular and has been around for a long time, that this scent was going to be incredible! My expectations were clearly set too high because WOW this stuff STANKS! It smelled like rotten eggs. I know I have an aversion to rum after a bad night at my friends wedding in 2015 but I thought I could put that in the past for the sake of my underarms. Unfortunately, this stuff really stunk and doesn’t even smell like rum anything! Not even rum raisin ice cream or malibu or a beautiful fresh bay!

One thing I’ve noticed since buying Lumé from Amazon is that the consistency of each deodorant is never the same. Sometimes it’s an oozing, soupy mess, other times it’s a light fluffy consistency that’s just perfect, then it also can come out like a gritty, frosting that struggled to exit the 3 little holes on the deodorant stick.

I’m a big guy and I sweat a lot and there’s a lot of space to cover on my underarms, so I never have been confident in Lumé’s 72-hour claim however I’ve had success with about 24 hours (not with Bay Rum though). Right now I’m using Tangerine and it’s nice and lasts for a little bit… definitely not as long as the OG scents they discontinued, but I can make it through most of the summer day without smelling like a disgusting heap of trash!

Some of the other scents don’t last that long on me, but when I put rotten egg smelling Bay Rum on me I really don’t feel like I’m covered at all. I used this for a bit of June and had to throw it out because I couldn’t even go a few hours without smelling stinky. As a fat person, I’m very aware of my size, my personal hygiene and of course how I smell.

Anyways, stay away from this gross scent - maybe I got a bad batch of it, but I’m just scratching my head at how Amazon says this is the most popular scent. Maybe they’re all just trying to sell off this disgusting batch.

BRING BACK JUNIPER BREEZE!

profile.title: I was so excited
profile.text:
I was so excited to try this deodorant. I hoped it would help me on long summer days walking to work and then working 8+ hour shifts.

It has caused my arm pits to burn, turn bright red, hurt so bad especially at night when arms stuck together in my pit region. Certain shirts started to hurt, it was literally the worst. Anything touching my arm pits soap, water, clothing.

I denied it was the deodorant for about a month. I finally stopped using it, switched back to dove 3 days ago. My arms are still red and discolored but they longer hurt.

I am very unsatisfied with this product.

profile.title: No. No, no, no, no, no.
profile.text:
So, I used this as directed, on pits and other areas. This particular scent I wasn't fond of, but that's personal preference. Everything was fine, applied after each shower, no complaints.
Then I had a day I skipped the shower and stayed in bed all day (migraines). Next day, holy cats. This was not a, "Oh, time for a shower, starting to get a bit odiferous." This was a, "OMG DO YOU STINK!" It literally smelled like someone living in a dumpster for several weeks.
But I thought, when it stops working, it STOPS working. Good to know. But then the same exact scent emanated from the groin area. Ladies' pits and groins do not create the same chemical reaction/odors. This was not a lack of odor protection, this is creating the odor.
It could very well just be my body chemistry, but this one does NOT work for me.

Its one BIG redeemer is that it is one of the only deodorants out there that is good for sensitive skin. My underarms tend to break out in a rash in response to 9/10 of the deodorants out there. I have to use Lume or Arm and Hammer. Personally, I don't think there's much difference in efficacy, but I will give Lume an edge on longevity.

I will say the bay-rum scent is good, but a little overpowering at the start. It also fades after about ~3 hours.

I have seen kits like this online and was so excited to try it. I don't do very much to my eyebrows and this seemed like and easy way to do a glow up. The "stamp" is powdery, like eye shadow and the stencils are one time use stickers and all the same shape. The color is accurate, and once i figured out it was a powder in the cap of the stamp it was easier to apply. I'm not sure this product is going to work for me for daily use, but I still need to play with it more.

I received this item through Amazon Vine and voluntarily give my honest review.

profile.title: Not A Bad Little Eyebrow Kit!
profile.text: I ordered this dark brown Eyebrow Stamping Kit to see if it would be any better than using the standard eyebrow pencil.  Now, granted I have barely any eyebrows due to hypothyroidism, so finding something that looks natural is key.  I love this little kit.  It comes in a very handy little plastic zip lock bag which includes, the brow powder, 24 eyebrow stencils, and 4 eyebrow/eyelash brushes.  It was a bit difficult sorting through all 24 stencils but I narrowed it down to 4 initially, then down from there to 3, then 2, then 1.  On my right eyebrow(your left in the 4th pic), I did my eyebrow with the standard eyebrow pencil how I usually shape it.  I thought by doing one to compare to, it might make it easier to find the closest shape to what I do.  After finally selecting the stencil I was going to use, it was easy to peel it off the paper and apply to my skin/eyebrow.  I may have stretched it a little, I am not sure.  The brow powder applicator doesn't twist or push up.  It just has powder in the tip automatically.  Oh, I forgot to mention that on the back of the stencil box, there are instructions.  So, I kind of dabbed the brow powder on, but I do think it helps if you have eyebrow hairs for it to cling to in the first place!  I do at the start, but my ends are gone!  The brow powder is a bit loose and a small amount fell over the sink.  I then peeled the stencil off(was easy and didn't hurt).  I show the immediate results in pic 7.  In my opinion, it was a bit thick(I'm more "old school" and like my eyebrows thin), so I took a wet tissue and wiped a bit away and made it more narrow.  I also used one of the eyebrow/eyelash brushes to feather it out a little.  Then my final results are in pic 8.  I would say NOT BAD.  From far away it does look more natural than the pencil shaped one which is thinner and more precise.  Natural brows are not like that!  I will say though, it is not exactly "water proof".  Sure, if some raindrops got on it, it wouldn't immediately take it off, but it was easy to remove with a wet tissue and soap.  I think with both brows the same, I could get used to using this kit.  I am not sure how long the brow powder will last in the tube, but having the eyebrow stencils is handy and quick.  For the price, I would definitely recommend it!

*You should be rinsing your new lashes before applying them anyway.*
The hair fiber they used has a very natural luster, not too shiny, not too dull. The hair is also very dark, which I love cuz I don’t like having to put black mascara on top.
I love the triangle packaging different from the standard rectangle, it was a nice way of switching things up.

Not sure if the cracked container was a one off situation or not because no other reviews. If you’re up for a challenge, go for it!

One nail, with one coat of flowers, took 2 min 30 seconds under UV gel to set (my typical polish takes 60 seconds.

profile.text: This is for my wife who has short and thick hair undergo a surgery and is not ready for shower/hair wash on her own. It's easy to use, to be fair to say. profile.title: Stretchy
profile.text: As a healthcare worker, you just want to keep your personal washable hair cap.  I’ve got several hair caps from amazon—this one so far met my need.  It’s stretchy.  After long hours of shift—it soft, covers the head/hair well. although I still have some little short hairs that Escapes on the side.  Most likely will need a long rubber hair band to keep the loose hair together.  With the fabric hair caps—those tends to get hot, tying it gives me headache after a while— perhaps due to tightness.  The worse is, I feel like the fabric/cotton/thick ones tend to pull the hair/hairline tight or backwards that I feel like it’s making my hairline recede. Idk, maybe it’s just me. But end of shift, it sure feels heavy.  But with this elastic/jersey material cap is light, soft, flexible & serves me well.  Simple yet useful

profile.title: Durable bamboo handle paired with a soft bristled brush, stop the plastic. Buy.
profile.text:
Pros:
One of the oldest known types of toothbrushes
Sustainable bamboo instead of plastic
Environmentally friendly toothbrush
Super soft modern nylon bristles
Biodegradable bamboo handle
Smaller ecological footprint
Bamboo grows very fast
Strong and durable
Ecological
Cute

Cons:
Synthetic bristles
Still will likely end up in a landfill
Premium price for handmade toothbrush

Bamboo bristle toothbrushes have historically been one of the oldest known toothbrushes, having originated out-of-China, over (500) years ago (Library of Congress). The bristles were made from boars’ hair and the handle from bamboo. Nylon bristles came about around 1938. Today, some toothbrushes still use boar’s bristles, however, some say there are concerns about the action of the natural bristles on the enamel and gums, so many still recommend soft nylon bristles. Here, we have a natural bamboo handle, which is sturdy and durable, with little to no bend and very smooth, so someone took time to sand this down. The bristles are very soft. Which is easy on the gums and enamel. The toothbrush head and handle are perfect for a little one’s mouth, allowing access to those small to reach places. Practicing good oral hygiene is so important, at a young age. Our little one found this toothbrush perfect in size to maneuver about and the bristles comfortable. We see no shedding of a single bristle at this early stage; and plan to rotate this out of commission, after its effectiveness appears of concern, after a bad cold, or just after so many months of service. With that in mind, cost is always a concern. These are no bargain basement toothbrushes. They are a premium product in our opinion and are priced accordingly. Bamboo toothbrush handles can be composted, used as kindling, and can be repurposed for other household uses. However, just like plastic toothbrush handles, they will take up space in a landfill if just thrown away. We reconsidered using plastic toothbrushes, and now choose bamboo toothbrushes as an alternative to the plastic, which ends up in landfills. Plastic is not designed to break down and plastic toothbrushes are difficult to recycle. We decided bamboo to be an excellent alternative to reduce plastic waste at home. Finally, our little one gave this bamboo toothbrush, with its cute design laser burned into the handle two (2) thumbs up for fit, having that fun handle design, unique style, soft bristle comfort, lack of odor, and ease of using. We agree.

profile.title: Updated-Great natural soap
profile.text:
Update: I would like to update my review to reflect new understanding of the importance fair trade and natural ingredients are to the makers of this soap. They go to great lengths to ensure both of these elements are integrated into their wonderful product. With that said, the cost is very fair and less expensive than some of the other makers of castille bar soap...and I also love that the soap lasts awhile and doesn't disintegrate fast when wet. (They also have wonderful natural beeswax candles!)

Original: I recently have tried to go more natural with products my family uses. This soap was an unexpected delight. Although a bit pricey, I do enjoy both the calming light scent as well as the bit of texture that the soap has. It acts as an exfoliate. The bar sizes are not large but easy to hold and don't slip out of my hand like others do. I also like the companies structure and desire to help others!

profile.title: Excellent quality, fast shipping & made in America!
profile.text: This family owned company is absolutely amazing! Their Castile soap is handmade in America. We only use natural soap in our home and I love that Bee the Light Castile soap only uses ingredients that are natural and sustainably grown. All of the soap was packaged carefully and nothing was damaged upon shipping. Opening up the package (I ordered the variety pack of orange citrus, peppermint and lavender) filled my kitchen with the most beautiful of smells! I am so grateful for their attention to detail and high  quality Castile soaps. Check out their beeswax candles as well-these are equally amazing!

profile.title: Awesome Soap!
profile.text: Love this soap!  I will continue to order it for our whole family.  Gentle, natural, high quality, and smells so good.  I love knowing my children are using soap without any harsh ingredients.  Perfect size for children or adults.  I also plan to use this soap as a gift for Christmas and Birthday presents for friends.  I love the natural packaging and I feel good ordering it from an authentic company that makes really great products. I highly recommend this product to anyone!

profile.title: High quality, rich and moisturizing
profile.text: My new favorite soap. The scented soaps were natural and therapeutic and didn't have overpowering or irritating smells like a lot of natural product lines. profile.title: Excellent Castile Soap!
profile.text:

profile.title: Satisfied Repeat Customer
profile.text:
BACK STORY
I only wear raw hair so I’ve ordered curly hair (3 bundles of 20 inch) from this company’s website last year and loved it. So I had to try another texture from them. This time I ordered the wavy hair 3 bundles of 24 inch from their Amazon page. After purchasing from here I received an email from the seller asking what pattern of wavy I would like and showed pictures of the different textures. I chose Deep wave which is there waviest wave. My hair arrived to Houston Texas in 3 days (I don’t have prime). The hair was just as amazing as the curly hair that I ordered from this company last year (which I still wear and looks just as it did when I initially purchased). I also included a photo of the curly hair (it’s the armpit length hair and I have one a white top).

HAIR SPECS
3 bundles of Deep wavy. This wavy hair is true raw hair so it is FULL even when ordering long lengths. You only need 3 bundles! Also the hair is truly 24 inches and even slightly longer. I have received virtually no shedding or tangling.

MAINTANACE
I put this hair in a very loose bun (pineapple) on the very top of my head. Then I wrap a scarf around to prevent frizzing when sleeping. I never wet the hair or “refresh” in between washes. I simple wash and condition the hair once a week and let it air dry. No leave in products used.

FINAL THOUGHTS
I love this company and will continue to purchase from them as long as they sell high quality raw hair. Highly recommend to anyone who does not like Chinese made blend hair commonly sold nowadays.

Thought I finally found the right clips for thin hair.
After 2 uses this clip snapped in 2.
The banana clips are very difficult to open. So I don't know how sturdy they are at this point.
Update: after closer inspection I found the clip wasn't broken. Just came apart. There is a slot, I was unaware of, so repaired for now.
For those of us with arthritis in our hands, this type of clip is better than most as far as ease of use.

profile.title: I missed my banana clips!
profile.text:
I have a banana clip!!! I was feeling nostalgic. I lived in banana clips from like 17 - 20. They're awesome because it's like spreading the base of a pony tale from the top to the bottom of your head giving a pony mane effect. They're perfect for curly hair.

I'm fifty, if you used to wear them like me you'll remember there were two sizes. These are the longer size. It was funny that when I opened the package I immediately looked for which end had the wide piece and which had the little ball hinge. These are crappy cheap versions of what I remember. They're very difficult to open. I filed down the little nub on the opening end with a nail file and that helped. Having said that, I love them!

I've been working from home during lockdown for a year and usually have a scrunchie on top my head or a butterfly clip in the back. My new banana clip is so much more comfortable. I will be wearing one in my Zoom meeting tomorrow.
